checking

Class CompilerOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • checking.CompilerOutput

  • public class CompilerOutput
extends java.lang.Object
    Output Object that stores the compiler output.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CompilerOutput()
      The constructor initializes the lists for errors, warnings and infos from the compiler.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addError(java.lang.String newError)
      Compiler errors are flaws in the code that make compilation impossible.
      void addInfo(java.lang.String newInfo)
      Compiler infos are messages that do not concern flaws in the code but rather messages in which the compiler conveys some internal information, such as which config file is used or what version of the compiler we are running.
      void addWarning(java.lang.String newWarning)
      Warnings are flaws in the code that do not hinder compilation but are problematic nontheless, like calls deprecated methods.
      boolean compilerInvoked()
      Checks if compiler invoked.
      boolean compilerStreamBroken()
      Checks if compiler stream broken.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCompilerErrors()
      Gets the compiler errors.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCompilerInfos()
      Gets the compiler infos.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCompilerWarnings()
      Gets the compiler warnings.
      boolean isCleanCompile()
      Checks if compile was clean.
      void setClean(boolean compileRunWasClean)
      The clean flag indicates whether the compiler ran without errors or warnings.
      void setCompilerInvoked(boolean compilerWasInvoked)
      The compilerInvoked flag indicates whether the compiler could actually be called of if no call occured.
      void setCompileStreamBroken(boolean streamBroken)
      The compileStreamBroken flag indicates whether a successful read from the compiler output stream has taken place.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CompilerOutput

        public CompilerOutput()
        The constructor initializes the lists for errors, warnings and infos from the compiler. Also flags are set to default values. compilerInvoked is set to false, since no compiler has been called at this point from this objects perspective. The compiler stream isn't broken since it does not exist and there was no clean compile run yet.

    • Method Detail

      • addError

        public void addError(java.lang.String newError)
        Compiler errors are flaws in the code that make compilation impossible.
        Parameters:
        newError - The error message for exactly one compile error. You should not put more than one error in one entry.

      • addWarning

        public void addWarning(java.lang.String newWarning)
        Warnings are flaws in the code that do not hinder compilation but are problematic nontheless, like calls deprecated methods.
        Parameters:
        newWarning - Exactly one warning. Do not put more that one warning into one entry.

      • addInfo

        public void addInfo(java.lang.String newInfo)
        Compiler infos are messages that do not concern flaws in the code but rather messages in which the compiler conveys some internal information, such as which config file is used or what version of the compiler we are running.
        Parameters:
        newInfo - Exactly one info. Do not put more than one in one entry.

      • setClean

        public void setClean(boolean compileRunWasClean)
        The clean flag indicates whether the compiler ran without errors or warnings.
        Parameters:
        compileRunWasClean - A boolean value to set the internal flag to.

      • setCompileStreamBroken

        public void setCompileStreamBroken(boolean streamBroken)
        The compileStreamBroken flag indicates whether a successful read from the compiler output stream has taken place.
        Parameters:
        streamBroken - A boolean value to set the internal flag to.

      • setCompilerInvoked

        public void setCompilerInvoked(boolean compilerWasInvoked)
        The compilerInvoked flag indicates whether the compiler could actually be called of if no call occured.
        Parameters:
        compilerWasInvoked - A boolean value to set the internal flag to.

      • compilerInvoked

        public boolean compilerInvoked()
        Checks if compiler invoked.
        Returns:
        true, if successful compiler invocation.

      • compilerStreamBroken

        public boolean compilerStreamBroken()
        Checks if compiler stream broken.
        Returns:
        true, if compiler stream broken

      • isCleanCompile

        public boolean isCleanCompile()
        Checks if compile was clean.
        Returns:
        true, if clean compile
